JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Ineta Ziemele;Ledi Bianku;Päivi Hirvelä;Paul Mahoney;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , is a NORP citizen of NORP - NORP descent , resident in GPE .

A charitable trust arrangement of the type known as “ vakf ” was set up in DATE by PERSON and PERSON concerning CARDINAL immovable properties was set up to administer PERCENT of the income for charitable purposes , PERCENT for the families who had worked for the PERSON family and PERCENT for the PERSON descendants in perpetuity . The applicant claims to be a beneficiary of the said trust as heir of her father who died in DATE . Her father had received income from the trust until DATE when the NORP forces invaded GPE . Her mother had been the last “ mutevelli ” or administrator of the trust until her death in DATE , after which ORG ( the administrative body supervising vakf property ) took over the administration of the trust .

On DATE , the applicant requested the Attorney - General ’s permission to commence legal proceedings against the ORG for breach of trust in that no income had been paid to beneficiaries and to have herself appointed as the mutevelli of the trust , and for the property to be vested in her name as the mutevelli .
On DATE , the Attorney - General refused to give consent .

On DATE , the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG without consent from the Attorney - General , claiming appointment as mutevelli and vesting of the properties in her name and naming ORG as defendant .

The Attorney - General filed opposition , raising issues as to the jurisdiction of the court in the absence of his consent . He also disputed that the applicant had any right to be appointed mutevelli , there being other beneficiaries who could make that claim also .

A hearing was held on DATE . On DATE , ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims , principally because of the lack of consent given by the Attorney - General . It noted that vakf property was now vested in the Custodian of NORP - Cypriot properties pursuant to LAW CARDINAL/CARDINAL and that the Custodian had possession of all properties where the NORP - Cypriot owners did not live in the Republic . The applicant ’s lawyer had raised allegations during the hearing claiming that the Custodian if now regarded as the effective administrator of the trust property should be replaced due to bad administration but this allegation did not fall to be examined as no grounds seeking remedies on this basis had been properly lodged .
On DATE , the applicant served notice of appeal against the judgment . After a hearing on DATE , ORG rejected the appeal in a judgment dated DATE , upholding the reasoning of the previous decision .
The relevant case - law and laws are set out in GPE and Others v Cyprus ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL et al , § § CARDINAL , decision of CARDINAL DATE ) .
